title: Easy Ways to Get Deleted Instagram Pics Back

steps.title: Tap your profile image or the silhouette icon.
steps.content: Tap your profile image or the silhouette icon. This is in the lower right corner of the Instagram app. Your profile page will open. This method will only work for posts that have been deleted for less than 30 days.

steps.title: Tap ☰.
steps.content: Tap ☰ . This three-line menu button is in the top right corner of your screen.

steps.title: Tap Your activity.
steps.content: Tap Your activity . It's under the "How you use Instagram" header.

steps.title: Tap Recently Deleted.
steps.content: Tap Recently Deleted . You'll find it under the "Removed and archived content" header.

steps.title: Tap the thumbnail that you want to restore.
steps.content: Tap the thumbnail that you want to restore. You'll see all your photos, Stories, reels, IGTV videos, and video posts here.

steps.title: Tap Restore to restore the post to your profile.
steps.content: Tap Restore to restore the post to your profile. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Tap your profile image or the silhouette .
steps.content: Tap your profile image or the silhouette . This is in the lower right of your screen. Your profile page will open. Since its introduction in 2017, the archive feature has been the default action for removing/hiding posts instead of deleting them. You might be able to find your old content here.

steps.title: Tap ☰.
steps.content: Tap ☰ . A menu will slide out.

steps.title: Tap Archive.
steps.content: Tap Archive . A list of your archived Stories will appear.

steps.title: Tap the Stories Archive drop-down.
steps.content: Tap the Stories Archive drop-down. A menu will drop down, and you can choose Stories Archive or Posts Archive .

steps.title: Tap Posts Archive.
steps.content: Tap Posts Archive . This displays the posts in your archive.

steps.title: Tap a post to view it.
steps.content: Tap a post to view it. You'll see a list of all the content you've archived, and tapping one will open it with more details and options. Your post and all its original comments will load. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Tap ⋮.
steps.content: Tap ⋮ . You'll see this at the top of the post.

steps.title: Tap Show on Profile to unarchive the post.
steps.content: Tap Show on Profile to unarchive the post. It will appear back in your Instagram timeline where it originally was.

steps.title: Open My Files.
steps.content: Open My Files. This app icon looks like a folder; you'll most likely find this on one of your Home screens, in the app drawer, or by searching. You'll only find an Instagram album if you enabled the feature in Instagram to save your posts locally. [3] X Research source You'll only find the videos/photos you took with the Instagram app camera, not the entire post you created. You also will not find pictures you uploaded from your default camera roll into Instagram here. But this might be your best option if you're looking for posts older than 30 days.

steps.title: Tap Internal Storage.
steps.content: Tap Internal Storage . You'll see this listed below "Recent files" and "Categories."

steps.title: Tap Pictures.
steps.content: Tap Pictures . You might have to scroll down to see this.

steps.title: Tap Instagram.
steps.content: Tap Instagram . You'll see all the pictures you took from the Instagram app.

steps.title: Open Photos.
steps.content: Open Photos. This app icon looks like a multicolored flower. You can find this app on your home screen or by searching. You'll only find an Instagram album if you enabled the feature in Instagram to save your posts locally. [4] X Research source You'll only find the videos/photos you took with the Instagram app camera, not the entire post you created. You also will not find pictures you uploaded from your default camera roll into Instagram here. But if you're looking for pictures older than 30 days, this might be your best option.

steps.title: Tap the albums icon at the bottom of your screen.
steps.content: Tap the albums icon at the bottom of your screen. It's usually the second from the right icon next to "Search." [5] X Research source

steps.title: Tap the Instagram album.
steps.content: Tap the Instagram album. You'll see all the pictures and videos you took from the Instagram app, but you won't find a copy of the entire post.
